computer science You must have heard of the master slave flip flop Ok Who must have read some digital circuits etc. Or something like master slave flip flop Let's discuss in this what is master slave architecture First let's see what is its need When it is used What is my normal architecture Suppose I have a server S1 server S2 server S3 server Ok What is your here Load Balancer You get multiple requests Multiple requests Use Billions of requests You get requests What does load balancer do Interface All requests go to load balancer And load balancer balances this load Send to the server which is least busy Ok This is the architecture Now suppose you have only one DB Now if you have only one DB All requests are going to go to this DB Right All requests are going to go to this DB So what can I say This DB will serve all servers as a database server All requests are going to come to this DB And this could be a single point of failure We have said a new term Single point of failure What does this mean If this database server crashes Or gets killed Or gets hacked for some reason Then your whole system will get blocked Availability will be zero All your requests will not be able to be
